alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 10:23PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Lowe River. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Lowe River. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - For Lowe River above Horsetail Falls near Valdez: At 10:00pm the stage was 13.89 feet. Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Impacts: At 10.0 feet: Emergency Managers begin monitoring levees in the Apline Woods (Whispering Spruce) subdivision. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
